name: esterification of rape oil | fatty acid methyl ester | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8298/documentation

Inventory refers to the production of 1 kg rape rape methyl ester, respectively glycerine, from rape oil. The multioutput-process 'rape oil, in esterification plant' delivers the co-products 'rape methyl ester, at esterification plant' and 'glycerine, from rape oil, at esterification plant'.

This process includes the esterification process of oil to methyl ester and glycerine, intermediate storage of the oil and products, treatment of specific wastewater effluents. System boundary is at the esterification plant.
category: C:Manufacturing/19:Manufacture of coke and refined petroleum products/192:Manufacture of refined petroleum products/1920:Manufacture of refined petroleum products

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data from 1998 to 2006, current technology in CH
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from biodiesel producers in CH, industrial data
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical rape oil esterification plant designed for rape methyl ester (RME) production (for use in the vehicle fuels market), Swiss context. Rape oil base-catalyzed transesterification (based on industrial data from biodiesel producer in CH).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from biodiesel producers in CH, industrial data

exchanges.description:
Literature, environmental report
Calculated based on literature (Sheenhan, J., 18, An Overview of Biodiesel and Petroleum Diesel Life Cycles; Omni Tech International, 2010, Life Cycle Impact of Soybean Production and Soy Industrial Products), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Assumed to have the same water use as 'soybean methyl ester, at esterification plant'. The process starts when refined oil enters the plant. It includes the processes: prepurification, deacidification, transesterification, destilation, etc. It is assumed that 95% of water use is allocated to cooling water and 5% of water is allocated as process water.

exchanges.description: Calculated as a difference between water on the input and water on the output.

Calculation, according to feed capacity and lifetime of the plant
This exchange has an activity link directly to the producing activity because the product is primarily consumed in the same geographical area where it is produced.

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature (Sheenhan, J., 18, An Overview of Biodiesel and Petroleum Diesel Life Cycles; Omni Tech International, 2010, Life Cycle Impact of Soybean Production and Soy Industrial Products), (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). Assumed to have the same water use as 'soybean methyl ester, at esterification plant'. The process starts when refined oil enters the plant. It includes the processes: prepurification, deacidification, transesterification, destilation, etc. The process ends when methyl ester leaves the plant. It is assumed that 95% of water use is allocated to cooling water and 5% of water is allocated as process water.
